Question Text: I fall asleep within 30 minutes most nights.
I wake up feeling refreshed after 7–9 hours of sleep.
My energy stays steady for most of the day.
I can do normal daily activities without unusual aches, strain, or pain.
I expect people to go out of their way to meet my needs.
My focus, memory, and mental clarity are reliable most days.
I feel physically resilient and bounce back quickly from exertion or stress.
My mood is generally positive and I handle daily stress without feeling overwhelmed.
My home, work, and neighbourhood spaces actively support my well-being.
I have enough private and personal space in my home.
My living and working spaces feel physically safe (no major hazards, mould, pests, broken stairs, etc.).
I get a good amount of natural daylight in the rooms where I spend most of my day.
Noise levels in my home and workspace allow me to rest and concentrate when I need to.
My spaces are reasonably organised and uncluttered (I can find things and move around easily).
I have regular access to nature (plants indoors, a garden, nearby park, or even a view of trees/sky).
My home and workspace feel like “me” — they contain colours, objects, or art that reflect who I am.
I believe rules don't apply to me the way they do to others.
Seeing other people’s highlight reels online makes me feel like I’m not good enough.
I feel anxious or empty if I don’t get likes, replies, or validation quickly.
I sometimes hide my real feelings or curate a “perfect” version of myself online.
Notifications and messages often interrupt my focus or time with people I care about.
I often say yes to requests even when I want to say no.
I never have trouble paying my bills on time.
I could comfortably handle a major unexpected expense (e.g., hospital bill).
I feel stressed about my personal finances.
I regularly set aside money for long-term savings.
I have a clear financial plan for the next few years.
I have a strong, unwavering belief that I will be safe and taken care of, regardless of external events.
I feel a deep sense of anxiety and instability regarding the future of the world (politics, environment, economy).
No matter what I do, bad things are bound to happen.
I finish whatever I begin, even when it’s tough.
I can handle unexpected situations well.
Scale Options: 0 = Not at all true → 3 = Exactly true

Question Text: I stay calm when facing difficulties because I trust my coping abilities.
Scale Options: 0 = Not at all true → 3 = Exactly true

Question Text: I feel capable of achieving the things that matter to me.
Scale Options: 0 = Not at all true → 3 = Exactly true

Question Text: I must always strive for perfection in everything I do.
I avoid conflict by giving in to what others want.
I often put off important tasks until the last minute, even when I know it will cause stress.
When someone challenges my viewpoint, I become defensive or struggle to listen.
I must have complete control over every situation to feel safe.
I find it hard to understand other people's needs or emotions.
I feel like an outsider in most groups.
I find it very difficult to trust that others will be loyal and reliable.
Social media use often leaves me feeling anxious or inadequate compared to others.
I find it difficult to allow myself to depend on romantic partners.
I feel emotionally close to my family and friends.
I am satisfied with the level of sexual and physical intimacy in my life.
I often worry that my partner will not want to stay with me.
I prefer not to show a partner how I feel deep down.
I prefer to keep my deep fears, self-doubts, or anxieties entirely private from my partner/friends.
I find myself excessively preoccupied with my partner’s (or close person’s) needs and feelings.
When I am deeply distressed, I turn inward and isolate myself rather than reaching out.
I am engaged and interested in my daily activities.
I actively contribute to the happiness and well-being of others.
I am competent and capable in the activities that are important to me.
I am a good person and live a good life.
I am optimistic about my future.
My friends, family, and colleagues treat me with respect.
I regularly feel a deep sense of meaning when I help or mentor others.
I often experience “flow” — getting completely absorbed in activities I love.
I make deliberate choices about how I spend my time based on what truly matters to me.
I feel grateful for my life most days, even when things get hard.
At the end of the day, I usually feel at peace with how I lived it.
As an adult, I went through divorce or major betrayal in a relationship.
As an adult, I experienced sexual or physical violence or assault.
As an adult, I had a serious accident or major health diagnosis.
Scoring Logic: 1 for Yes (Vulnerability to Harm or Illness)

Question Text: As an adult, I carry deep guilt or shame from something that happened.
As a teenager or young adult, I went through a painful romantic loss.
Growing up, one or both of my parents were often emotionally distant when I needed comfort.
I rarely received physical affection (hugs, cuddles) from the people raising me.
I felt I had to “grow up fast” and take care of others in the family.
My parents or caregivers fought a lot in front of me.
There were long periods when one parent was physically absent.
I was frequently bullied or left out by other children at school.
I felt emotionally neglected by my family.
I was physically disciplined in a way that seemed cruel.
Before 18, did an adult often swear at, insult, or put you down?
Before 18, did you often feel no one in your family loved or valued you?
Before 18, was a household member depressed or mentally ill?
Before age 18, I felt the need to protect myself from my parents or other adults.
Before age 18, I experienced being touched in a sexual way or being made to touch someone in a sexual way.
Before age 18, my parents had an active addiction (alcohol, drugs, gambling) that caused family chaos.
Before age 18, I witnessed my mother (or main female caregiver) being abused or physically hurt.
I feel deeply alone, even when I am physically with other people.
Scale Options: 1 = Not like me at all → 5 = Exactly like me

Question Text: Describe 5 adjectives for your childhood relationship with your mother (or main female caregiver), with a short example for each.
Describe 5 adjectives for your childhood relationship with your father (or main male caregiver), with a short example for each.
